column1: As  observed  by  this  court,  the  prosecution  case  is  not  yet  concluded.  The  accused-appellants  have  a

column2: statutory right of appeal once  the  final  order in the  High Court Trial  is  delivered  and  during the  main
circumstances  it  is  clear  that  the  accused-appellants  have  a  statutory  appeal  and  without  waiting  to

column1: make  use  the  said  right  they  have  come  before  this  court.  The  Petitioners  have  failed  to  show  any

column2: special circumstances which compel them  to  come before this court.  In the  said circumstances we are
not inclined to invoke our revisionary powers in the present case.
